column2: we planned to visit Chicago again
column3: thus made it my life mission to try their pizza. Unfortunately there's no Jay Z posters in sight but the pizza was so damn good. It was worth the pizza blue balls for 5 years. We had the Chicago classic with pepperoni as a deep dish and the thin crust with pepperoni and giardinera. (Omg totally in love with giardinera but that's another story) wow
column4: both pizzas deep and thin were the best pizzas I've ever had. I mentally scanned through all the pizza I've eaten from my home town Houston
column5: TX to my travels to Las Vegas
column7: LA. Nothing compares to the pizza foodgasm of Lou's.
